trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> objects within a control designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class, and any derived class, uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> class to contain and enumerate the designer regions for the control in a design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)].
For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method can be used to define and add regions to the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Owner%2A> property to access the control designer object that contains the designer region collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> methods and properties to examine and maintain the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> objects that are in the collection.
The collection dynamically increases as objects are added.
Indexes in this collection are zero-based.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Count%2A> property to determine how many designer regions are in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> members to provide the following functionality:
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Add%2A> method to add a single designer region to the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Insert%2A> method to add a designer region at a particular index within the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a designer region.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove the designer region at a particular index.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine whether a particular designer region is already in the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to retrieve the index of a designer region within the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Item%2A> indexer to get or set the designer region at a particular index, using array notation.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove all designer regions from the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> class.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create an empty collection.
You can add elements to the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Insert%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> class for the specified control designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor creates an empty collection and sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Owner%2A> property to the specified control designer object.

The visual designer, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor to initialize a designer region collection for a specific control designer.
You can add elements to the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Insert%2A> method.
The control designer that owns this collection of designer regions.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> object to the end of the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Add%2A> method adds the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object to the end of the collection.
To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object to the collection at a specific index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Insert%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> to add to the collection.
The index at which the region was added to the collection.
Removes all regions from the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove all regions from the collection.
To remove a specific region from the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Remove%2A> method.
To remove a region at a particular index, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified region is contained within the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Contains%2A> method determines equality by using the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Contains%2A> method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Count%2A> property.
Because template region collections are typically small, the performance of the linear search operation is not critical.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> to locate within the collection.
`true`, if the region is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the elements of the collection to an <xref href="System.Array"></xref> object, starting at a particular <xref href="System.Array"></xref> index.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Insert%2A> method to add the design regions to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> collection.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the copied regions.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> objects in the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Count%2A> property is commonly used to determine the upper boundary index when iterating through objects in the collection.
Because the collection indexes are zero-based, the first element is at index `0` and the last element is at index `Count-1`.
The number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> objects in the collection.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Count%2A> property together with a loop construct, such as `while`, `for`, or `foreach` statements, to enumerate through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> object.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Returns the index of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> object within the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.IndexOf%2A> method determines equality by using the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.IndexOf%2A> method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Count%2A> property.
Because template region collections are typically small, the performance of the linear search operation is not critical.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> to locate within the collection.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of region within the collection; otherwise, -1, if region is not in the collection.
Inserts a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> object into the collection at the specified index.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Insert%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object to the collection at a specific index location.
To add a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> to the end of the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Add%2A> method.
When you insert an item into the collection, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection.
The zero-based index within the collection at which to insert the region.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> to insert into the collection.
index is less than zero.
\- or -
index is greater than the property.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> object has a fixed size.
`true`, if the size of the collection cannot be changed by adding or removing items; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> object is read-only.
`true`, if the collection cannot be changed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> object is synchronized (thread safe).
Enumerating through a collection is not a thread-safe procedure intrinsically.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection.
This causes exceptions during enumeration.
Lock the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.SyncRoot%2A> method during the whole enumeration to guarantee thread safety.
`true`, if access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> is synchronized; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Item%2A> indexer to retrieve the region at the specified index within the collection or to set the region at the specified index within the collection.
You can index elements in the collection by using array notation.
For example, you can index an element at index `i` with the notation `DesignerRegions(i)` for Microsoft VisualBasic or `DesignerRegions[i]` for C#.
When you have a reference to the region object and need the index of the object in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> to get or set in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
value is less than zero.
\- or -
value is greater than the property.
Gets the control designer that owns the designer region collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Owner%2A> property provides a convenient means to access the control designer object for a designer region collection.

For example, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Owner%2A> property to determine the type of control designer that owns the collection and to access the properties and methods of the control designer.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner"></xref> that represents the control designer that owns the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref>.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> object from the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Remove%2A> method removes the first occurrence of the specified region from the collection.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> object does not contain the specified `region`, the collection remains unchanged.
No exception is thrown.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Remove%2A> method determines equality by using the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Remove%2A> method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Count%2A> property.
Because template region collections are typically small, the performance of the linear search operation is not critical.
To remove a region at a particular index from the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
To remove all regions from the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Clear%2A> method.
When you remove an item from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> to remove from the collection.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> object at the specified index within the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove a region at a particular index from the collection.
To remove a specified region from the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Remove%2A> method.
To remove all regions from the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.Clear%2A> method.
When you remove an item from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection.
The zero-based index within the collection of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> to remove.
index is less than zero.
\- or -
index is greater than the property.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> object.
Enumerating through a collection is not a thread-safe procedure intrinsically.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection.
This causes exceptions during enumeration.
Lock the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.SyncRoot%2A> method during the whole enumeration to guarantee thread safety.
For detailed information about locking collections for thread-safe access, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the copied regions.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.Count"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The number of elements in the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`true`, if access to the collection is synchronized; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The item to add to the collection.
The index at which the item was added to the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Clear"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> to locate within the collection.
`true`, if the region is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> to locate within the collection.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of the object within the collection; otherwise, -1, if the object is not in the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index within the collection at which to insert the object.
The object to insert into the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`false`, if the collection dynamically increases in size as new objects are added; otherwise, `true`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection.IsReadOnly"></xref> property.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Item(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the object to get in the collection.
The object at the specified index in the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The object to remove from the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.RemoveAt(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index within the collection of the object to remove.
